meanings.sent1: The sweltriest day of the year made it hard to breathe.
meanings.sent2: Today is the sweltriest day we've had all summer.
meanings.sent3: The sweltriest weather turned the ice cream into soup before we could eat it.
meanings.sent4: The sweltriest heatwave felt like being trapped in an oven.
meanings.sent5: Walking outside felt like stepping into the sweltriest sauna imaginable.

meanings.definition: The most oppressive or suffocating in terms of heat
meanings.sent1: The sweltriest in the room was unbearable, causing everyone to sweat profusely.
meanings.sent2: During the heatwave, the sweltriest was felt in the crowded city streets.
meanings.sent3: The sweltriest at the beach made it impossible to relax and enjoy the sun.
meanings.sent4: The sweltriest of the desert sun beat down relentlessly on the weary travelers.
meanings.sent5: The sweltriest of the summer heat enveloped the entire town in a blanket of discomfort.
